otherSecurity.type: Security interest in tenant's property on premises

includedItems: All costs of operating, maintaining, and insuring the premises

realtyTaxes.paymentMethod: Tenant pays directly or to Landlord within 21 days after due date

operatingCostsAndTaxes.taxMethodChanges: If taxation method changes (e.g., taxes levied on rents instead of property), Tenant still responsible unless the new tax is an income, estate, inheritance, succession, capital levy, corporate franchise, gross receipts, or transfer tax
operatingCostsAndTaxes.personalPropertyTaxes: Tenant liable for all personal property taxes on leasehold interest, personal property, and trade fixtures

complianceRequirements: Tenant must obtain all necessary licenses and permits

specificProhibitions: Any use other than warehouse and power generation
prohibitedUses.hazardousSubstances: Not explicitly prohibited, but environmental compliance required

signage.exteriorSignageRights: Yes - Tenant may erect signs at sole risk and expense; must conform with applicable laws and ordinances; must remove upon lease termination and repair damage
signage.interiorSignage: Yes - Tenant may erect, maintain, place usual and customary signs and fixtures
signage.approvalRequirements: Must comply with laws and ordinances; no landlord approval mentioned

landlordObligations.structural: Only defects in materials or workmanship during first 12 months
landlordObligations.roof: Only defects in materials or workmanship during first 12 months
landlordObligations.buildingSystems: Only defects in materials or workmanship during first 12 months
landlordObligations.exception: Not responsible for damage caused by sublessees, licensees, or contractors
landlordObligations.complianceRepairs: Landlord responsible for repairs related to latent defects existing at commencement

tenantObligations.interiorMaintenance: Tenant must repair and maintain premises in good order and condition
tenantObligations.janitorial: Tenant pays for all janitorial services
tenantObligations.allRepairs: All maintenance except reasonable wear and tear and except landlord's limited 12-month warranty
tenantObligations.lienFree: Tenant must keep property free of liens; must remove within 14 days or indemnify Landlord for removal costs

capitalImprovements.tenantObligations: Tenant responsible for improvements and construction

landlordWork.description: None specified - Tenant responsible for all construction

tenantWork.permitsResponsibility: Tenant must obtain all certificates, permits, licenses, and authorizations
tenantWork.performance: Tenant negotiates and supervises all contracts; must guarantee performance and workmanship for 1 year

leaseholdImprovements.ownership: Improvements become part of premises (benefit landlord at end of term)
leaseholdImprovements.removalAtEndOfTerm: Non-structural improvements: Tenant may remove if susceptible to removal without damage (or if damage repaired); Structural, mechanical, electrical, plumbing: Remain with property
leaseholdImprovements.restorationObligations: Tenant must repair any damage from removal

tradeFixtures.definition: Personal property, furnishings, equipment, and trade fixtures installed by Tenant
tradeFixtures.removalRights: Tenant may (but is not obligated to) remove at any time during term
tradeFixtures.restoration: Tenant must repair damage from removal

environmentalRemediation.requirement: Portion of premises requires environmental remediation
environmentalRemediation.responsibility: Tenant will undertake remediation and is responsible as if it were a structural alteration

landlordInsurance.costAllocation: Tenant reimburses Landlord for all insurance premiums connected with the premises

propertyInsurance.allRiskCoverage: Fire and extended coverage on premises and tenant property
propertyInsurance.duringConstruction: Builder's risk equal to 3x construction expenditure

tenantInsuranceRequirements.certificateRequirements: Copy of policy or certificate must be delivered to Landlord on or before commencement date
tenantInsuranceRequirements.cancellationNotice: No policy cancellable without 10 days prior written notice to Landlord

insuranceProceeds.adjustment: Tenant adjusts loss and settles claims
insuranceProceeds.assignment: Proceeds assigned to institutional first mortgagee (if any) or to Landlord and Tenant jointly
insuranceProceeds.trustFund: Proceeds paid into trust fund controlled by mortgagee or Landlord/Tenant jointly
insuranceProceeds.use: For repair, restoration, rebuilding, or replacement
insuranceProceeds.disbursement: Based on bills, sworn statement, and architect's certificate
insuranceProceeds.excess: Any excess proceeds are Landlord's property (subject to mortgagee rights)
insuranceProceeds.deficiency: If insufficient, Tenant suffers the deficiency

appliesTo: Property loss or damage covered by fire and extended coverage insurance
waiverOfSubrogation.scope: Landlord and Tenant release each other from liability to extent of insurance coverage

tenantIndemnifiesLandlordFor: All injury, loss, claims, or damage to persons or property while on premises
Exception: Unless caused by willful acts, omissions, or gross negligence of Landlord, its employees, agents, licensees, or contractors
landlordIndemnifiesTenantFor: Loss or damage to tenant property if Landlord notified of needed repairs, fails to perform, and loss results from that condition
indemnification.lienIndemnity: Tenant indemnifies Landlord for all costs, expenses, including attorney's fees, to remove liens if Tenant fails to remove within 14 days of notice

casualtyProvisions.landlordRepairObligation: Must repair, restore, replace, or rebuild premises (excluding Tenant's leasehold improvements) to substantially the same condition as before damage
casualtyProvisions.performance: Must proceed forthwith and prosecute diligently to completion
casualtyProvisions.timeToRepair: Building permit: Must obtain within 90 days of damage; Completion: Must complete within 9 months of damage
casualtyProvisions.failureToPerform: If Landlord fails to get permit within 90 days OR complete within 9 months, Tenant may cancel with 90 days written notice
casualtyProvisions.substantialDamageDefinition: 25% or more of replacement cost (exclusive of land and foundations)
casualtyProvisions.substantialDamageTiming: If occurs during last year of term or any renewal term
casualtyProvisions.substantialDamageRights: Either Landlord or Tenant may terminate; Party electing termination must notify other within 30 days of damage occurrence

rentAbatement.duringRepairs: Rent and other charges abated or adjusted proportionally
rentAbatement.basis: Proportional to portion of premises tenant is deprived of and time of deprivation
rentAbatement.calculation: Work of repair shall not reduce insurance proceeds payable under rent insurance policy

insuranceApplication.proceedsUse: All proceeds must be used for restoration per trust fund provisions
insuranceApplication.control: By institutional mortgagee if any, or by Landlord and Tenant jointly
insuranceApplication.disbursement: Via supervised draw process with architect certification

transferRestrictions.assignmentAllowed: Yes - Tenant has absolute right to assign
transferRestrictions.sublettingAllowed: Yes - Tenant has absolute right to sublet all or any portion
transferRestrictions.condition: Tenant must not be in default at time of assignment/sublease
transferRestrictions.useLimitation: Assignee/sublessee's use expressly limited to provisions of this lease

permittedTransfers.affiliateTransfers: Allowed (absolute right provision covers all transfers)
permittedTransfers.cessationOfBusiness: Tenant may cease operating business on premises

transferRequirements.financialCovenant: Implied - assignee/sublessee must comply with lease terms
transferRequirements.ongoingLiability: Not specified, but standard practice would be original tenant remains liable

nonPayment.definition: Three (3) or more occasions of payment received 10+ days after due date (whether consecutive or non-consecutive)
nonPayment.gracePeriod: Effectively 10 days (late fee applies, but not default until 3rd occurrence)

lienFiling.event: Tenant causes lien to be filed against Landlord's property

breachOfCovenants.extendedCure: If reasonably takes more than 30 days, must commence within 30 days and diligently prosecute to completion

eventsOfDefault.bankruptcyInsolvency: Any proceeding by or against Tenant seeking reorganization, arrangement, composition, readjustment, liquidation, dissolution under bankruptcy law; 60 days grace period - proceeding must be dismissed within 60 days; Exception: Non-dismissal not a default if all lease obligations continue to be performed

landlordRemedies.termination: Give notice of termination; Lease expires on specified date; Tenant surrenders premises; Tenant remains liable for obligations through termination date
landlordRemedies.damagesUponTermination: Recover all damages incurred by reason of default; Including present value of excess of: (a) all rent for remaining term over (b) aggregate reasonable rental value for same period; All immediately due and payable
landlordRemedies.acceleration: Declare all rent and amounts for entire remaining term immediately due; NOT deemed penalty or liquidated damages - payment in advance; Tenant entitled to receive rents Landlord receives from other tenants during term; Net of Landlord's costs, expenses, attorney's fees for reletting; Cannot exceed amount Tenant paid
landlordRemedies.relettingWithoutTermination: Enter and take possession without terminating lease; Remove persons and property; Store property at Tenant's cost; Relet as Tenant's agent with or without advertisement; Any term, any conditions Landlord deems necessary; No liability for failure to relet or collect rent; Proceeds applied: (1st) other Tenant debt to Landlord, (2nd) reletting costs including brokerage and attorney's fees, (3rd) rent due, (4th) held for future rent; May grant rent concessions - Tenant not credited; Tenant pays any monthly deficiency; May later elect to terminate
landlordRemedies.suspendServices: Suspend furnishing property, material, labor, utilities, or other services; No liability, no constructive eviction; While Tenant in default
landlordRemedies.letPremisesRemainVacant: Collect rent as it comes due
landlordRemedies.forecloseSecurity: Immediate taking of possession of all property on or in premises
other: Pursue remedies available at law or equity
landlordRemedies.nonExclusivity: Pursuit of remedies does not constitute election of remedies, preclude other remedies (concurrent or sequential), serve as basis for constructive eviction claim, or allow Tenant to withhold payments

tenantSelfHelp.conditions: If Landlord defaults and doesn't cure within 30 days (or commence and diligently pursue if takes longer)
tenantSelfHelp.rights: Tenant may cure for Landlord's account; Landlord must reimburse Tenant; Tenant may deduct from next or succeeding rent payments
tenantSelfHelp.disputes: If disputed by Landlord, may be resolved through arbitration or declaratory judgment (Landlord bears filing fees)

interestOnLatePayments.calculationMethod: 5% of monthly rent if not postmarked or received by 10th day of month

costs.legalFeesResponsibility: Prevailing party recovers reasonable attorney's fees, court costs, and all expenses
costs.limitationPeriod: No action may be filed more than one year after cause of action accrued

allUtilities: All other services incident to use of premises

serviceInterruptions.rentAbatement: Only if Tenant deprived of use due to Landlord's repair work
serviceInterruptions.forceMajeure: Yes - performance excused for delays beyond party's control except payment obligations
forceMajeureEvents: Act, failure to act, or default of other party
War or other reason beyond control
Exception: Lack of funds NOT considered beyond control

tenantObligations: Perform work in good and workmanlike manner
environmentalCompliance.hazardousSubstances: Not specifically addressed in terms of prohibitions

environmentalRemediation.existingCondition: The parties understand that a portion of the Leased Premises requires environmental remediation
environmentalRemediation.responsibility: Tenant anticipates it will undertake remediation and will be responsible
environmentalRemediation.treatment: Remediation treated as if it were a structural alteration or addition
environmentalRemediation.landlordConsent: Same requirements as structural alterations apply

environmentalIndemnity.scope: Not explicitly stated beyond general indemnification provisions

remediation.accessForTesting: Landlord may examine premises at reasonable times

subordination.leaseSubordinateTo: Present or future institutional mortgages upon Landlord's written request
subordination.timing: Irrespective of execution or recording time of mortgage
conditions: Non-Disturbance: In foreclosure or other action, lease and Tenant's rights not disturbed and continue in full force if Tenant not in default
Proceeds: Mortgagee permits insurance and condemnation proceeds to be used for restoration/repair
subordination.attornment: Tenant will recognize mortgagee or successor as Landlord under lease terms
subordination.assumption: Mortgagee/successor must assume all Landlord obligations for period in possession and their successors

definitions.mortgage: Includes mortgages, deeds of trust, similar instruments, and modifications/extensions
definitions.institutionalMortgage: Mortgage securing loan from bank (commercial/savings), trust company, insurance company, pension trust, or other institutional lender constituting lien on premises

landlordTitle.warranty: Landlord warrants it owns premises in fee simple absolute
landlordTitle.encumbrances: Free and clear except for easements, covenants, restrictions of record as of lease date
landlordTitle.lienPriority: Lease is and shall be first lien, subject only to mortgages to which lease is subordinated per agreement and encumbrances caused by Tenant's acts or omissions
landlordTitle.authority: Landlord has full right and authority to execute lease
landlordTitle.zoning: No legal impediment to use; premises zoned for use or may continue via non-conforming use
landlordTitle.titleReport: Landlord must furnish one title report within 30 days of Tenant's written request (at no expense to Tenant)

quietEnjoyment.condition: Tenant must pay rent and perform all covenants
quietEnjoyment.protectionFrom: Hindrance or molestation from Landlord or persons claiming through Landlord

surrenderRequirements.cleaning: Must yield premises in good order and repair

overholding.status: Tenancy at will, not lease extension or renewal
overholding.rentDuringOverholding: Same rental as during lease term (or last renewal), prorated monthly

relatedPartyTransaction.signatory: Same individual (Jay Hooper) signed as Manager of Landlord and President of Tenant

specialProvisions.paymentUnderProtest: Either party may pay disputed amounts 'under protest'; Payment not deemed voluntary; Right survives to institute suit for recovery; If party not legally obligated, may recover payment; Applies to both money payments and performance of disputed work; Tenant may withhold/deduct recovered amounts from rent
specialProvisions.tenantRightToCureLandlordDefaultMortgage: If Landlord fails to pay mortgages, liens, or encumbrances that might affect Tenant's interest; Or fails to pay interest on same; Tenant may pay and charge to Landlord; Tenant may withhold and deduct from rent; Any excess over rent shall be paid by Landlord to Tenant

financialStatementReliance.requirement: Tenant must furnish financial statement prepared by accountant concurrently with lease execution
financialStatementReliance.warranty: Tenant represents and warrants all information complete, true, and correct
remedies: Fully executed guaranty by acceptable third party
Hold Tenant personally and individually liable

governingLaw.attorneyFees: Prevailing party recovers fees, court costs, expenses
governingLaw.limitationPeriod: No action more than one year after cause of action accrued

specialProvisions.extraordinaryRemedies: Parties may obtain injunctive relief for breach; Available regardless of whether adequate remedy exists at law

5% late fee assessed if not received
Remove liens or face indemnity claim

ongoingMonthlyCosts.note: Cannot calculate without square footage or tax/insurance data

constructionImprovementCosts.note: Unknown - Exhibit B (plans and specifications) not provided

environmentalRemediation.risk: Could range from tens of thousands to millions depending on contamination

rentVsPurchaseComparison.analysis: After approximately Year 5 (around June 2018), cumulative rent paid approaches purchase price. Given Tenant is paying for all improvements, remediation, and triple net expenses, purchase option becomes increasingly attractive over time. This structure suggests intent may be for Tenant to eventually purchase the property.

criticalRedFlags: Related Party Transaction: Jay Hooper signed as both Manager of Landlord (Temple CB, LLC) and President of Tenant (Okra Energy, Inc.). Potential conflict of interest; questions arm's length nature of transaction
Both Parties Share Same Address: Landlord and Tenant both at 4350 Temple City Boulevard, El Monte, CA 91731 (the leased property). Suggests common control or related entities

Missing Legal Description (Exhibit A Blank): Fundamental ambiguity about precisely what property is being leased. Could render lease unenforceable; title insurance issues; difficulty with assignments or financing
Missing Plans and Specifications (Exhibit B Blank): No definition of what Tenant is obligated or permitted to construct. Disputes over scope of work, compliance, completion standards
Error in Rent Schedule: Rent schedule jumps from June 1, 2017 to May 31, 2018: $60,000 to June 1, 2019 to May 31, 2020: $70,000 - missing June 2018-May 2019. Ambiguity about rent for 12-month period
No Square Footage Specified: Cannot calculate rate per square foot; difficulty comparing to market; financing issues. Challenges with subleasing, financing, property valuation

Environmental Remediation - Existing Contamination: Lease acknowledges portion of Leased Premises requires environmental remediation with Tenant responsible. Unknown scope and cost of cleanup; potential liability exceeding tens or hundreds of thousands
favorableTerms: Six-Month Rent-Free Period: December 1, 2013 to May 31, 2014: $0 rent. Value: $180,000+ (assuming would otherwise pay at escalated rate)
Graduated Rent Increases: Stepped increases from $30K to $70K over 6 years. Tenant-friendly ramp-up allows revenue growth before full rent burden
Low Security Deposit: Only $20,000 deposit. Low compared to typical first + last month's rent. At $70K/month rate, deposit is less than 1/3 of one month
Fixed Renewal Option Rate: Five 1-year renewals at fixed $100,000/month. No market rate adjustments or escalations. Provides long-term rate certainty

Option to Purchase at Fixed Price: $3,000,000 fixed purchase price anytime during term. Extraordinarily valuable - price doesn't increase over time. After cumulative rent approaches $3M, purchase becomes attractive. Combined with Tenant-funded improvements, this is highly favorable
Cancellation Right: Tenant may cancel anytime for $300,000 + amounts due. Extraordinary flexibility to exit lease. Combined with purchase option, Tenant has complete control over outcome

Absolute Assignment/Subletting Rights: Tenant has absolute right to assign or sublet. No landlord consent required. Highly unusual and extremely tenant-favorable. May cease operating business on premises

Broad Alteration Rights: Non-structural alterations without approval. Structural alterations with consent not to be unreasonably withheld. Can remove non-structural improvements at end of term. Signage rights without landlord approval
Tenant Self-Help with Rent Offset: If Landlord defaults, Tenant may cure and deduct from rent. May cure Landlord's mortgage defaults and offset. Payment under protest rights
Weak Default Triggers: Must have 3 late payments (10+ days) before default. 30-day cure periods for most breaches. 60 days for bankruptcy before default
Favorable Overholding Terms: Holdover at same rent (month-to-month). No 150-200% penalty typical in commercial leases
Strong Non-Disturbance Rights: SNDA required as condition of subordination. Tenant cannot be disturbed in foreclosure if not in default
Rent Abatement Rights: If deprived of use due to damage, repairs, or landlord work. Proportional to time and area deprived
Long Cure Periods: 30 days for most covenant breaches. Extended if reasonably necessary to complete cure
unfavorableTermsRisks: Triple Net Lease Structure: Tenant pays ALL expenses: taxes, insurance, maintenance, utilities, repairs. No caps or limitations on operating expenses. Unpredictable costs
Tenant Pays ALL Landlord's Insurance Premiums: Tenant reimburses for all insurance on premises. No control over coverage Landlord selects. Could be substantial expense
Unknown Operating Costs: No square footage = cannot estimate taxes, insurance, utilities. Industrial power generation use may have high utility costs

All Construction Costs on Tenant: 100% of improvement costs borne by Tenant. No tenant improvement allowance. Must carry builder's risk insurance = 3x expenditure. All construction delays and cost overruns on Tenant

MAJOR: Environmental Remediation Responsibility: Tenant accepts responsibility for EXISTING contamination. No Phase I or Phase II report referenced. No scope, no cost estimate, no cleanup standards defined. Could cost tens of thousands to millions. Ongoing regulatory liability and reporting
No Environmental Indemnity from Landlord: Landlord not indemnifying Tenant for pre-existing conditions. Tenant bears all risk of unknown environmental issues

Minimal Landlord Repair Obligation: Only 12-month warranty for defects in materials/workmanship. After first year, tenant responsible for essentially everything. Includes structural, roof, HVAC, all building systems
No Landlord Services: Tenant pays for all utilities, janitorial, services. No landlord-provided HVAC, electricity, water, or any services
Landlord Can Transfer Security Deposit: In bona fide sale, Landlord may transfer deposit to purchaser. Landlord released from liability. Tenant must look to new owner for return

High Insurance Requirements: $1M liability per accident / $250K property damage. Business interruption insurance. Builder's risk during construction = 3x expenditure. All risk of loss during construction on Tenant

Insurance Proceeds Structured Against Tenant: During construction: proceeds payable to Landlord. After construction: excess proceeds belong to Landlord. If insufficient: Tenant shall suffer the deficiency. Tenant bears shortfall risk but Landlord gets overage
Long Landlord Repair Timeframes: Landlord has 90 days to get permit, 9 months to complete. Tenant cannot terminate until those periods expire
Tenant Improvements Excluded from Landlord Repair: Landlord only repairs base building. Tenant must rebuild its own improvements

Broad Landlord Remedies: Can accelerate all rent for entire remaining term. Can terminate lease and sue for all future rent. Can relet and charge deficiencies monthly. Security interest in all Tenant property on premises. Can suspend services/utilities while Tenant in default
Three-Strike Rule on Late Payments: Three late payments (even non-consecutive) = default. Late defined as 10+ days after due date. Combined with 5% late fee
Assignment Impact Despite Absolute Right: Use by assignee/sublessee limited to warehouse and power generation. May limit pool of potential assignees/sublessees
Complex Subordination: Must subordinate to institutional mortgages on Landlord's request. While SNDA required, adds complexity
Short Statute of Limitations: Must file any action within one year of cause of action accrual. Shorter than typical statute of limitations
Jury Trial Waiver: Both parties waived right to jury trial. Disputes resolved by judge alone
Personal Liability Provision: If financial statement inaccurate or material change, Landlord may hold Tenant personally liable. Could pierce corporate veil
itemsRequiringFurtherReview: CRITICAL: Obtain Legal Description - Exhibit A is blank - must obtain proper legal description. Cannot record lease or obtain title insurance without it. Potentially fatal defect if not resolved

CRITICAL: Obtain Phase I Environmental Report - Portion of premises requires environmental remediation. Must understand scope, cost, liability before proceeding. Obtain Phase I ESA, possibly Phase II. Negotiate cap on remediation costs or share cost with Landlord. Define cleanup standards and completion criteria
CRITICAL: Clarify Rent Schedule - Obtain written clarification of rent for June 2018 - May 2019 period. Execute amendment to correct rent schedule

CRITICAL: Investigate Related Party Transaction - Understand relationship between Temple CB, LLC and Okra Energy, Inc. Why same signatory for both parties? Is this arm's length transaction? Tax and corporate governance implications
CRITICAL: Obtain Construction Plans (Exhibit B) - Define scope of Tenant's work. Estimate costs. Determine if improvements justify rent and purchase option economics
Determine Rentable Area - Conduct ANSI/BOMA measurement. Calculate rate per square foot. Compare to market rates for industrial in El Monte, CA
Property Survey - Obtain current ALTA survey. Identify boundaries, easements, encroachments. Verify improvements can be legally constructed
Develop Operating Budget - Estimate real estate taxes, insurance costs, utilities for warehouse and power generation use, maintenance and repair reserves
Compare to Market Rates - Research comparable industrial warehouse rents in El Monte, CA. Analyze if graduated rent schedule is market, above, or below
Evaluate Purchase Option Economics - Is $3M purchase price fair market value? What is property worth after Tenant-funded improvements and remediation?
Environmental Remediation Cost Estimate - Obtain quotes from environmental contractors. Understand regulatory requirements. Determine completion timeline. Negotiate cost-sharing or cap with Landlord
Review Insurance Requirements - Obtain quotes for required coverage levels. Verify $1M/$250K is adequate for warehouse + power generation use
Obtain Builder's Risk Quote - 3x construction cost requirement is extremely high. Typical is 1x construction cost. Negotiate reduction
Title Search and Insurance - Obtain preliminary title report. Identify all encumbrances, easements, restrictions. Verify no impediments to permitted use
Verify Zoning - Confirm property zoned for warehouse and power generation. Identify if power generation requires special permits
Verify Landlord's Ownership - Confirm Temple CB, LLC is fee simple owner. Verify Jay Hooper has authority to sign on behalf of LLC
Define Power Generation Use - What type of power generation? What permits required? Noise, emissions, safety regulations?
Permitting Analysis - Identify all permits needed for improvements and power generation. Estimate timeline for permit approvals
Utility Interconnection - If power generation for sale/export, need utility interconnection agreement. California has complex rules for distributed generation
Environmental Permits for Power Generation - Air quality permits (South Coast AQMD is very strict). Water discharge permits if applicable
Fire and Life Safety - Industrial warehouse + power generation may have special requirements. Sprinkler systems, fire alarms, exits
Amendment to Correct Defects - Execute comprehensive First Amendment to attach proper exhibits, correct rent schedule, add square footage, define environmental remediation scope and cap costs
Verify No Existing Mortgages - Landlord warrants property free and clear. Verify no existing mortgages. If mortgages exist, obtain SNDA before proceeding
Review Financial Statement Provision - Understand what financial statement was provided. Was it accurate? What constitutes material change?

Evaluate Three Exit Options - Model cash flows and returns for: (1) Operate through full term + renewals, (2) Exercise purchase option at optimal time, (3) Exercise cancellation right if project not viable

notesAndComments: This is a highly unusual industrial lease with several red flags and unique characteristics that require careful analysis before proceeding. Primary concerns include: (1) related party transaction with same signatory for both landlord and tenant, (2) missing critical information including blank exhibits for legal description and construction plans, (3) environmental liability with tenant accepting unknown remediation costs for existing contamination, and (4) rent schedule error with missing year. The lease appears to be structured as a lease-to-own transaction given tenant-funded construction and improvements, purchase option at $3,000,000 (total base rent over term is $3,840,000), tenant-funded environmental remediation, and the fact that after approximately 5 years, rent paid approaches purchase price. The economic analysis shows a 6-month rent-free period is valuable ($180,000+) and graduated rent is tenant-friendly, but triple net expenses, construction costs, and environmental remediation add substantial unknown costs. The risk profile includes potentially very high environmental risk, high construction risk, medium-high operating cost risk, high legal risk due to related party transaction and missing exhibits, and unknown market risk without square footage data. Given the complexity, unusual terms, related party nature, environmental issues, and missing critical information, this lease should be reviewed by qualified legal counsel before execution or performance, particularly expertise in commercial real estate, environmental law, corporate governance (related party transactions), and real estate finance.
